1:
"Think also about crocodiles.\q2 Can you catch them with a fishhook
\q2 or fasten their jaws with a rope?
\q1
2:
Can you put ropes through their noses to control them\q2 or thrust hooks through their jaws?
\q1
3:
Will they plead with you to act mercifully toward them\q2 or use sweet talk in order that you will not harm them?


\q1
4:
Will they make an agreement with you to work for you,\q2 to be your slaves as long as they live?
\q1
5:
Can you make them into pets like you do birds?\q2 Can you put a leash around their necks so that your servant girls can play with them?
\q1
6:
Will men who partner in selling fish try to sell them in the market?\q2 Will they cut a crocodile up into pieces and sell the meat?


\q1
7:
Can you pierce crocodiles through their hides by throwing fishing spears at them?\q2 Can you pierce their heads with a harpoon?
\q1
8:
If you grab one of them with your hands, it will give you a battle that you will never forget,\q2 and you will never try to do it again!
\q1
9:
It is useless to even hope to subdue them.\q2 Anyone who tries to subdue one of them will fall to the ground out of fear.


\q1
10:
No one dares to make a crocodile angry.\q2 So, since I am much more powerful than they are, who would dare to cause me to be angry?
\q1
11:
Also, everything on the earth is mine.\q2 Therefore, no one is able to give anything to me and require me to pay money for it!
\q1
12:
I will tell you about how strong crocodiles' legs are\q2 and how strong their well formed bodies are.


\q1
13:
Can anyone strip off their hides?\q2 Can anyone pierce through their double layer of armor?
\q1
14: Can anyone pry open their jaws, which have terrible teeth in them?\q1
15:
They have rows of scales on their back\q2 which are as hard as rock.


\q1
16:
The scales are very close together;\q2 not even air can get between them.
\q1
17:
The scales are joined very closely to each other,\q2 and they cannot be separated.
\q1
18:
When crocodiles sneeze, the tiny drops of water that come out of their noses sparkle in the sunlight.\q2 Their eyes are red like the rising sun.


\q1
19: It is as though sparks of fire poured out of their mouths.\q1
20:
Smoke pours out of their nostrils\q2 as steam comes out of a pot that is put over a very, very hot fire.
\q1
21:
Their breath can cause coals to blaze\q2 and flames to shoot out from their mouths.


\q1
22:
Their necks are very strong;\q2 wherever they go, they make people very afraid.
\q1
23:
The folds in their flesh are very close together\q2 and are very hard.
\q1
24:
They are fearless\q2 because the inner parts of their bodies are as hard as a rock,
\q2 as hard as the lower millstone on which people grind grain.


\q1
25:
When they rise up, they cause even very strong people to be terrified.\q2 As a result, people fall back.
\q1
26:
People cannot injure them with swords;\q2 spears, arrows, or or other weapons with sharp points cannot injure them, either.
\q1
27:
They certainly are not afraid of weapons made of straw or rotten wood,\q2 but they are not even afraid of weapons made of iron or bronze!


\q1
28:
Shooting arrows at them does not cause them to run away.\q2 Hurling stones at them from a sling is like hurling bits of chaff at them.
\q1
29:
They are not afraid of clubs anymore than they would be afraid of men throwing bits of straw at them,\q2 and they laugh when they hear a spear coming at them.
\q1
30:
Their bellies are covered with scales that are as sharp as broken pieces of pottery.\q2 When they drag themselves through the mud,
\q2 their bellies tear up the ground like a plow.


\q1
31:
They stir up the water and cause it to foam\q2 as they churn through it.
\q1
32:
As they go through the water, their wakes glisten.\q2 People who see it would think that the foam had become white hair.


\q1
33: There are no creatures on earth that I have created as fearless as crocodiles.\q1
34: They are the proudest of all the creatures;\q2 they are like kings over all the other wild animals."
